Key Match Events: The Tigers mounted a comeback in the later innings for a 4-3 win over the Tampa Bay Rays.
Colt Keith finished 2-for-4 with two RBIs.
The Tigers scored two runs in the eighth inning against left-handed reliever Garrett Cleavinger for a 4-3 lead.
Keith tied the game, 3-3, with an RBI single.
Justyn-Henry Malloy hit a sac fly to center field, allowing Matt Vierling to score with a head-first slide from third base.
The Tigers stormed back in the sixth inning, with Matt Vierling working a seven-pitch walk, Keith ripping a triple, and Carpenter smacking a single.
Reese Olson made his third start since returning from the injured list, allowing two runs on four hits and zero walks with three strikeouts across four innings.
Casey Mize worked as a reliever for the first time in his professional career, giving up one run on three hits and zero walks with four strikeouts across two innings.
